bioghist.p: Samuel Wagner (1842-1937), nephew of William Wagner, assumed the presidency of the Wagner Free Institute of Science upon his uncle's death in 1885 and served in that role until 1921. From 1921 to 1937 he was President Emeritus of the Institute. Wagner was also a Trustee of the Free Library of Philadelphia and one of the founders of the Philadelphia Museum of Art.

scopecontent.p: This collection chiefly consists of records relating to properties on Federal and Manton Streets that were owned by the Wagner Free Institute of Science. These records, dated between 1844 and 1931, include deeds, mortgages, appraisals, and various court documents. The collection also includes paperwork on other properties and a 53 page typed memoir of Samuel Wagner (ca. 1934).
